alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 15 at 2:01PM MST until February 16 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR AREAS ALONG AND EAST OF I-25 AND ALONG AND SOUTH OF I-40 EXCLUDING THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS...LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY...ABOVE AVERAGE TEMPERATURES AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM MST WEDNESDAY FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS... .Above average temperatures will combine with strong southwest winds, very low relative humidity, and an unstable airmass to continue producing critical fire weather conditions mainly along and south of I-40 and along and east of I-25 excluding the Rio Grande Valley below any significant snowpack through early this evening. Strong southwest winds will continue through tonight into Wednesday across portions of the eastern plains. A Red Flag Warning is now in effect Wednesday for the East Central Plains. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM MST WEDNESDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM to 6 PM MST Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...East Central Plains through 6 PM this evening as well as from 11 AM to 6 PM MST Wednesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20-30 mph with gusts to around 40 mph this afternoon and southwest 25 to 40 mph with gusts to around 55 mph Wednesday afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 5 to 9 percent this afternoon and 10 to 15 percent Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
